Datatable.LocalizationPair: The Kapaku have had a troubled past with planets. After their first one was terraformed into a disgusting lush forest, and their second one froze over, the Kapaku decided to find their own, perfect, planet.
The Kapaku are strange race, with the unique ability to use geomancy, and a love for volcanic terrain.
The assimilation of the Kapaku leads to a similar disposition to Hot planets as the Kapaku themselves, which is one of awe and optimism.
The Kapaku have had Terraforming technology for much longer than most other races, and therefore, understand how to apply it more efficiently.
The Broken Lords in an emergency coalition of other factions, not to be outdone by the Vaulters, cooperated to develop spacecraft to escape Auriga.
Once a proud nation of chivalrous knights, now crippled with a curse that traps their spirit within their armor. They have yet to break their curse, but have lost their motivation to do so.
Using the vampiric power of the Broken Lords, but combined with safer methods, you can passively extract non-lethal amounts of dust from citizens.
Using the restorative power of dust that the Broken Lords have come to learn, you can make all slowly repair themselves.

Slowly escaping Auriga via sneakily stowing away on Exploration Vessels in generous numbers, the Forgotten eventually decided to start anew and dispersed throughout the galaxy. Eventually though they become disgusted at how similarly they were treated in these new lands that they decided to congregate and form their own nation once again.
Rogues and spies with a unique ability to turn invisible at will, the Forgotten use dirty tricks and thievery to get what they want.
The Forgotten have a truly amazing tactic for making pilots fly their ships faster: Threathen them.
Having an expertise in infiltration and spying has its perks, and making the Forgotten gunners makes weaponry more likely to hit.
